intro: Lophiolepis heldreichii subsp. euboica, commonly known as the Euboean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Greek island of Euboea. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. It is a perennial herb with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
